A 26-year-old nulligravida presents with primary amenorrhea. She is diagnosed with 46XY gonadal dysgenesis. During pelvic laparoscopy, what is the expected finding?

options.label: A
options.text: Streak gonads and male internal genitalia

options.label: B
options.text: Streak gonads and female internal genitalia

options.label: C
options.text: Empty pelvis (no gonads or internal genitalia)

options.label: D
options.text: Bilateral abdominal testes and male internal genitalia

questions.correct_answer: B. Streak gonads and female internal genitalia
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Streak gonads and female internal genitalia

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ In 46XY gonadal dysgenesis (Swyer syndrome) , the expected findings on laparoscopy are streak gonads and female internal genitalia . This condition occurs due to the failure of gonadal development and the absence of sufficient testosterone and Müllerian-inhibiting factor (AMH), resulting in a female phenotype despite the 46XY karyotype.
  • ➤ In 46XY gonadal dysgenesis (Swyer syndrome) , the expected findings on laparoscopy are streak gonads and female internal genitalia .
  • ➤ 46XY gonadal dysgenesis (Swyer syndrome)
  • ➤ streak gonads
  • ➤ female internal genitalia
  • ➤ This condition occurs due to the failure of gonadal development and the absence of sufficient testosterone and Müllerian-inhibiting factor (AMH), resulting in a female phenotype despite the 46XY karyotype.

questions.text: The visual field defect shown in the provided image, caused by which of the following conditions?
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Olfactory groove meningioma

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The junctional scotoma of Traquair (JST) is named after Harry Moss Traquair, a Scottish ophthalmologist known for his contributions to the field of perimetry. Junctional scotoma of Traquair are visual field defects that arise from damage to the junction of the optic nerve and the optic chiasm. Sellar masses including pituitary tumors are the most common cause of these visual field defects. Ophthalmologic findings include ipsilateral central scotoma and typically a contralateral superior temporal visual field defect. An olfactory groove meningioma as a potential cause of upper quadrant anopsia due to its characteristic compression of the optic chiasm, affecting fibers that represent the upper visual field.
  • ➤ The junctional scotoma of Traquair (JST) is named after Harry Moss Traquair, a Scottish ophthalmologist known for his contributions to the field of perimetry.
  • ➤ Junctional scotoma of Traquair are visual field defects that arise from damage to the junction of the optic nerve and the optic chiasm.
  • ➤ Sellar masses including pituitary tumors are the most common cause of these visual field defects.
  • ➤ Ophthalmologic findings include ipsilateral central scotoma and typically a contralateral superior temporal visual field defect.
  • ➤ An olfactory groove meningioma as a potential cause of upper quadrant anopsia due to its characteristic compression of the optic chiasm, affecting fibers that represent the upper visual field.

questions.text: A 32-year-old HIV-positive male presents to the emergency department with progressive shortness of breath, fever, and a dry cough over the past week. He has not been taking antiretroviral therapy or prophylactic medications. On examination, his oxygen saturation is 89% on room air, and he has bilateral crackles on auscultation. questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Trimethoprim-sulfamethoxazole (TMP-SMX)

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Pneumocystis jirovecii pneumonia is a common opportunistic infection in HIV-positive patients with CD4 counts <200 cells/µL. Prompt treatment with TMP-SMX and supportive care, including oxygen and corticosteroids if indicated, is essential for managing this life-threatening condition. Prophylaxis with TMP-SMX should be initiated in patients with low CD4 counts to prevent PCP.

questions.text: Which histological variety of breast carcinoma has the best prognosis?
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Tubular carcinoma

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Tubular carcinoma of the breast is associated with the best prognosis among the invasive breast cancer subtypes. It is well-differentiated, slow-growing, and has a low risk of metastasis. Early diagnosis and appropriate management are crucial in optimizing outcomes for patients with this type of breast carcinoma. Other subtypes, such as medullary , colloid , and lobular carcinoma , have more variable prognoses and generally worse outcomes than tubular carcinoma.
  • ➤ Tubular carcinoma of the breast is associated with the best prognosis among the invasive breast cancer subtypes.

  • ➤ lobular carcinoma
